bugs.creator: Radovan Synek
bugs.cf_release_notes: When trying to execute the MVEL modify command on a stateful session an exception occurs (unable to resolve method). This was caused by a omission in the following line: sbuilder.append( setter.getAccessor() + " = " + setter.getValue() + "\n" ); which should have been: sbuilder.append( setter.getAccessor() + " = '" + setter.getValue() + "'\n" );. The error has been corrected and the issue no longer occurs.
bugs.summary: drools modify command mvel exception

bugs.cf_release_notes:
PATCH NAME:
        Bug 809302 - One off patch
        Built upon previous roll up patch BZ-787847
PRODUCT NAME:
        JBoss Enterprise BRMS
VERSION:
        5.2.0
SHORT DESCRIPTION:
       NPE while creating activations if a fact is modified by prior consequences
LONG DESCRIPTION:
       A NPE in terminal nodes can be raised if a same fact is updated in different agenda/rulefow groups

MANUAL INSTALL INSTRUCTIONS:
       To install this patch replace the following with the jar from BZ809302.zip
       For BRMS Manager: $JBOSS_HOME/jboss-as/server/$PROFILE/jboss-brms.war/WEB-INF/lib/drools-core-5.2.0.BRMS.jar
       For BRMS Engine: The drools-core-5.2.0.BRMS.jar included with your application.
COMPATIBILITY:
 
DEPENDENCIES:
       N/A
SUPERSEDES:
       N/A
SUPERSEDED BY:
       N/A
CREATOR:
        Neil Wallace
DATE:
        April 10th 2012
bugs.summary: NPE while creating activations if a fact is modified by prior consequences

bugs.creator: Lukáš Petrovický
bugs.cf_release_notes: In instances where an incorrect request was issued to the human task server, the incorrect request would result in a runtime exception that caused the human task server to die, which meant no more requests could be processed. This has been resolved by ensuring the human task server is not affected by runtime exceptions, and the process requests continue in the human task server.
bugs.summary: JBPM-3688: Human Task dying issues

bugs.creator: Babak Mozaffari
bugs.cf_release_notes: Different application servers provide different forms of access to UserTransaction when running in a non-managed thread. Usually UserTransaction is accessible via JNDI but can be registered under different namespaces for different application servers. As a result of this, when there was no access to transaction instances a failure occurred. To resolve this issue known JNDI namespaces were added (EAP5 and EAP6), and others can be defined by setting the system property jbpm.ut.jndi.lookup, ensuring that UserTransaction can be accessed via JNDI.
bugs.summary: Handling task deadlines in container causes TX errors

bugs.cf_release_notes: A Business Process Management swimlane error would occur when a process model was generated with a swimlane positioned at the default position. This would cause the swimlane to touch the modeling canvas border. Accordingly, the Process Designer would fail to create correct BPMN2 for swimlanes with borders outside or touching the modeling canvas border. This has been resolved by altering the default swimlane position to not touch the modeling canvas borders.

As a result, the StatefulKnowledgeSession was created with the default configuration instead of the properties provided by the user. To resolve this issue, the default values of the KnowledgeSessionConfiguration properties can no longer override the user provided values. The StatefulKnowledgeSession is now created using the actual configuration defined by the user.

bugs.cf_release_notes: When closing an example application all other applications were closed as well, this was because every GUI example dialogue called System.exit() when it was disposed of. This resulted in the user having to restart each example application if they wanted to look at another example. bugs.creator: Hao Wu
bugs.cf_release_notes: This issued was caused because createPackageSnapshot did not rebuild the package binary when the content of the package had changed since the last build. As a result of this, the snapshot could contain out of date content from the previous package build. This has been resolved by checking if the package binary is up to date. The createPackageSnapshot operation (either from REST API or from JBoss Enterprise BRMS user interface) will fail with an error message of "Your package has not been built since last change. Please build the package first, then try 'Create snapshot for deployment' again". If you get this error message, try to rebuild the package first, then call createPackageSnapshot again.
bugs.summary: REST API: Snapshot after update binary content doesn't produce new snapshot

bugs.creator: Jiri Locker
bugs.cf_release_notes: Business process instances could not be accessed concurrently when Jboss Enterprise BRMS was clustered due to the persistence context not being cleared. This prevented single process instances from being managed by JBoss Enterprise BRMS in a clustered environment. To resolve this issue, the persistence context is now cleared on the transaction boundary level, and process instances can be managed in a clustered environment.
bugs.summary: Transaction rollback failure after concurrent access: no transaction!

bugs.cf_release_notes: Enumerations that were defined for fields, either as Java enumerations or Guvnor enumerations, in super-classes or wrapped classes were not being detected, and their values were being displayed in a text box, when it should have appeared in a listbox of enumerated values. This has been resolved by improving support for enumeration fields in super-classes and wrapped classes, and the values are now correctly displayed in a list box.
bugs.summary: No listbox for enum fields declared in parent class (sub-class or delegated class)

bugs.cf_release_notes: Some fully qualified inner class names were being incorrectly parsed and the import statements that were automatically generated for nest classes were incorrect. This caused the completion of knowledge packages with the incorrect import statements to fail, and users had to manually alter the generated import statements. This has been resolved by ensuring the fully qualified inner class names are correctly parsed. The import statements generated for inner classes are now correct, and knowledge packages including import statements for inner classes now compile without the need for manually altering of the import statement.
bugs.summary: RTE with Nested Classes, BRL and Java

bugs.cf_release_notes: Some fully qualified inner class names were being incorrectly parsed and the import statements that were automatically generated for nest classes were incorrect. This caused the completion of knowledge packages with the incorrect import statements to fail, and users had to manually alter the generated import statements. This has been resolved by ensuring the fully qualified inner class names are correctly parsed. The import statements generated for inner classes are now correct, and knowledge packages including import statements for inner classes now compile without the need for manually altering of the import statement.

bugs.creator: Maciej Swiderski
bugs.cf_release_notes: According to the BPMN2 specifications, a terminate node, when executed on a sub-process, should only terminate the execution in that sub-process; however, an error occurred in which the entire process instance would terminate. This has been resolved by terminating only the sub-process and allowing the parent process to continue executing.

bugs.creator: Maciej Swiderski
bugs.cf_release_notes: Previously, for intermediate conditional events to be able to a specific process instance's variables rules, the name of the variable had to be 'processInstance'. This prevented users from using any name for variables in conditional event rules. This issue has been resolved by checking the object type instead of relying on the hardcoded variable name. It is now possible to use any name for variables in conditional event rules.

bugs.cf_release_notes: A bug in lock acquisition between the PseudoClock and the Agenda was creating a deadlock, as a result, the engine would deadlock when running fireUntilHalt() in one thread and trying to advance the PseudoClock in a second thread. This has been resolved by properly handling the locks between the agenda and the clock, and the deadlock is no longer created.

bugs.cf_release_notes: The business rules engine could not resolve functions when a declared type was used as an argument for a function and resulted in compilation failure. This has been resolved by loading the Java Class corresponding to the declared type when compiling the function. It is now possible to use a declared type as an argument for a function.

bugs.creator: Maciej Swiderski
bugs.cf_release_notes:
A NullPointerException could occur when retrieving process definitions from the asset repository, which resulted in the process definitions not loading.
This has been resolved by ensuring the knowledge agent is null safe. The process definitions are now loaded without throwing a NullPointerException.

bugs.creator: Maciej Swiderski
bugs.cf_release_notes: Process instances were locking after sub-processes completed because the parent process was not updated by the sub-process. This has been resolved by ensuring the parent process instance is also updated. Process instances are no longer locking and are able to continue.
bugs.summary: JBPM-3679  Problem with subprocesses embedded in multi-instance nodes

bugs.creator: Maciej Swiderski
bugs.cf_release_notes: A runtime exception was occurring when variables were present in a single string but were not separated by a space character. The variables were not resolving and preventing the system from functioning normally. Support has been added to resolve multiple variables supplied in a single string and the runtime exception no longer occurs.
bugs.summary: JBPM-3659  Variable resolution fails if two (or more) variables are in the same string

bugs.creator: Maciej Swiderski
bugs.cf_release_notes: In cases where an unexpected error in the process flow occurred, the started by timer was not rescheduled properly, instead it was reregistered which caused duplicate executions. This was resolved by ensuring that timers are only registered once even when unexpected errors occur.
bugs.summary: JBPM-3454  Repeating intermediate timer events will only fire if the attached process completes successfully.

bugs.creator: Jiri Locker
bugs.cf_release_notes: When accessing business-central via Mod_jk load balancer, an exception occurs during Resteasy HttpServletDispatcher service() method and the login process is not completed. The exception is raised in the Resteasy code when the request's content-type header is processed, because this header contains the wrong value. This issue only presents when using Firefox 7 and above, and can be avoided by open the configuration panel of FireFox (In the address bar type about:config). Accepting the warning. Searching for network.http.accept-encoding, and changing the default value (gzip, deflate) to *;q=0.1,gzip,deflat.
bugs.cf_environment:
RHEL5 (for BRMS)
Fedora 17 (for EWS)
OpenJDK 6
BRMS 5.3.0-P01 standalone
EWS 1.0.2
Firefox 7+ (including 10 and 14)

bugs.cf_release_notes: When a POJO had annotations both in the Java class and in the corresponding DRL declared type, only the annotations in the DRL were taken into account. As a result, annotations on the POJO were lost. This has been resolved by merging annotations on both the POJO and the declared type. It is now possible to use annotations in both the POJO and the corresponding declared type.

bugs.cf_release_notes: If a process ends when persistence is enabled, the process is removed from the DBMS ProcessInstanceInfo table. However, the task table and the data related to the process are not deleted from the DBMS, causing an unnecessary growth of DBMS data. This has been resolved with the implementation of a TaskCleanUpProcessEventListener that cleans up tasks when the process instance related to them ends.

bugs.cf_release_notes: Previously, there were no public API methods available to get tasks based on the process instance ID. This prevented users from accessing lists of tasks associated with any give process instance. The API methods getTasksByProcessInstanceIdStatus and getTasksByProcessInstanceIdStatusTaskName have been created and can be used to return tasks by process instance ID and task status, or by process instance ID, task name and task status. This ensures tasks can be returned for a given process instance.
bugs.summary: Creation of getTasksByProcessInstanceIdStatus and getTasksByProcessInstanceIdStatusTaskName as public API

bugs.creator: Maciej Swiderski
bugs.cf_release_notes: When a rule or a process raises an exception the agenda is reset by marshaling the old one and unmarhaling it into a new one. The unmarhaling process had a bug causing the duplication of the main agenda group in the resulting agenda. After the raising of an Exception and the subsequent reset of the agenda, the agenda itself was no longer usable. This has been resolved, and now the agenda works correctly even after an exception is thrown by a rule or a process.
bugs.summary: Duplicated main agenda group on session reset

bugs.cf_release_notes: A bug in the variable resolver for mvel was raising a java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException whenever a rule required the use of subnetworks, for instance, when an entry point was used inside an accumulate construct. As a result of this, it was impossible to use any such rules with the mvel dialect. Java dialect was still working fine, but all rules authored in Guvnor use the mvel dialect and it is not possible to change that. The variable resolver was fixed, and now, rules that include such constructs can now be used without problems.

bugs.cf_release_notes:
PATCH NAME:
        BZ-909202
PRODUCT NAME:
        JBoss Enterprise BRMS Platform
VERSION:
        5.3.1.GA
SHORT DESCRIPTION:
	Enable password encryption for user credentials on jBPM configuration files
LONG DESCRIPTION:
        This is one-off patch for BRMS 5.3.1.GA. This patch includes the following fix:
        [BZ-909202] Enable password encryption for user credentials on jBPM configuration files
        The jbpm-gwt-pbe-5.3.1.BRMS-jar-with-dependencies.jar  in the patch
        zip is executable jar which can generate the encrypted password.
        [BZ-917003] [One-Off] The jbpm.xml file in designer.war doesn't handle passwords with special characters that can be part of URLs for the REST call

MANUAL INSTALL INSTRUCTIONS:
   Apply the patch jar:
    - Back up and remove the following files:
	<deployment_path>/business-central-server.war/WEB-INF/classes/jbpm.console.properties
	<deployment_path>/designer.war/profiles/jbpm.xml
	<deployment_path>/designer.war/WEB-INF/classes/org/jbpm/designer/web/profile/impl/JbpmProfileImpl.class
	<deployment_path>/designer.war/WEB-INF/classes/org/jbpm/designer/web/profile/impl/JbpmProfileImpl$1.class
	<deployment_path>/designer.war/WEB-INF/classes/org/jbpm/designer/web/profile/impl/JbpmProfileImpl$2.class
	<deployment_path>/designer.war/WEB-INF/classes/org/jbpm/designer/web/repository/impl/UUIDBasedJbpmRepository.class
	<deployment_path>/designer.war/WEB-INF/classes/org/jbpm/designer/web/server/ServletUtil.class
  <deployment_path>/jboss-brms.war/WEB-INF/classes/org/drools/guvnor/server/files/OryxEditorServlet.class
  <deployment_path>/jboss-brms.war/WEB-INF/classes/org/drools/guvnor/server/files/OryxEditorServlet$1.class
  <deployment_path>/jboss-brms.war/WEB-INF/classes/org/drools/guvnor/server/files/RepositoryServlet$Command.class
  <deployment_path>/jboss-brms.war/WEB-INF/classes/org/drools/guvnor/server/files/RepositoryServlet.class
    - Copy the files from BZ-909202.zip to the same locations:
    cp BZ909202/business-central-server.war/WEB-INF/classes/jbpm.console.properties <deployment_path>/business-central.war/WEB-INF/classes/
    cp BZ909202/business-central-server.war/WEB-INF/lib/*.jar <deployment_path>/business-central.war/WEB-INF/lib/
    cp -r BZ909202/designer.war/* <deployment_path>/designer.war/
    cp -r BZ909202/jboss-brms.war/* <deployment_path>/jboss-brms.war/

ENABLING PASSWORD ENCRYPTION
1. when using the pbe jar to create the encrypted password, please specify a system property, for example:

java -Dexternalpwdkey=/Users/tmp/pwd.txt -jar jbpm-gwt-pbe-5.3.1.BRMS-jar-with-dependencies.jar 

the system property has to be called externalpwdkey and has to point to a file on the file system which contains the password key.

2. When starting the application server, users also have to specify this system property on startup via for example

./standalone.sh -Dexternalpwdkey=/Users/tihomirsurdilovic/tmp/pwd.txt

this will then be picked up by both designer and jbpm console if they are running inside the same app server.

note that the default setting in designer jbpm.xml and console jbpm.console.properties is still pwd encryption turned off, users still have to turn it on in both places for pwd encryption to take place

To enable password encryption, please alter the value of the 'guvnor.pwd.enc'		property in the business-central-server.war../jbpm.console.properties file to 'true' and alter the value of the `externalloadurl' 'pwdenc'	property in the designer.war../jbpm.xml' file to 'true'.

COMPATIBILITY:
        BRMS 5.3.1.GA
DEPENDENCIES:
        NA
SUPERSEDES:
        NA
SUPERSEDED BY:
        NA
CREATOR:
        Ryan Zhang
DATE:
        12th March, 2013
